meanings.definition: Fices (noun): plural form of fice, a small dog
meanings.sent1: The park was filled with playful fices running around.
meanings.sent2: She adopted two fices from the animal shelter.
meanings.sent3: The little fices chased their tails in circles, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her heart melted when she saw the tiny fices cuddled up together.
meanings.sent5: The fices' barks echoed through the neighborhood, bringing joy to all.

meanings.definition: Fices (verb): third person singular present of fice, to snarl or snap
meanings.sent1: He fices whenever someone tries to take his favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: The dog fices at strangers who come too close to the fence.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy old cat fices at anyone who dares to disturb its nap.
meanings.sent4: His temper flared, causing him to fices at the slightest provocation.
meanings.sent5: The warning signs were clear when the dog started to fices at the mailman.

meanings.definition: Fices (adjective): comparative form of fice, more fickle or capricious
meanings.sent1: She was feeling fices today, unable to make up her mind about anything.
meanings.sent2: The weather in spring can be quite fices, changing from sunny to rainy in minutes.
meanings.sent3: His fices behavior kept everyone guessing what he would do next.
meanings.sent4: The fices winds blew in different directions, making sailing challenging.
meanings.sent5: The fices nature of the cat made it impossible to predict its actions.
